title: Introducing: Female Band
body:
There’s not a huge amount to be said about **Female Band** because there doesn’t seem to be a whole lot of information on her, yet as all good music, her creativity speaks for itself.

What I was able to glean is that her name is Anna Vtorova and she released her two track EP on Mancunian label Haus of Pins back in mid-September. The name of the EP is Jacksonville and consists of two tracks, _He Takes Her On The Dance Floor_ and _Jacksonville._ Both show an incredible talent despite their seemingly simple repetitive nature, especially on _Jacksonville_, this dark menacing chord vibrates through you as her distorted voice seeps through the lo-fi fog. On _He Takes Her On The Dance Floor_ it’s almost impossible to hear her soft-spoken voice through the completely distorted and glitchy bass manipulation. According to the [only interview I could find with her](http://www.tyci.org.uk/wordpress/haus-of-pins-presents-female-band/), she draws a lot of influence from trip-hop and bass artists, such as Massive Attack, Portishead, Raime, Alva Noto and more. This is her 2nd EP, having released her first on Italian Beach Babe Records entitled _Good Bye New York, Forever_. With 2014 fast approaching, it’ll be fascinating to witness what she comes up with in the new year, especially with such a diverse and innovative sound. Give a listen to both EPs below:
